award_name.ja: 電気学会A部門 学術貢献賞

paper_title.en: A debris-flow monitoring devices and methods bibliography

description.en: Debris-flow monitoring has two functions, warning and modeling. The warning function includes the following parameters: occurrence prediction and detection, proximity sensing, and discharge-estimation. The parameters obtained from debris-flow measurements can deduce a numerical model for creating a hazard map and designing various types of control structures to mitigate the hazards. Many devices and methods of monitoring are tabulated here for comparative study. Some of them are in operation. Advanced comparative studies lead to an improvement in debris-flow monitoring, an integrated system that can be applied to any torrent, and a breakthrough in future developments.

paper_title.en: An oil-immersed microphone sensor for improved debris-flow detection

description.en: An improved microphone sensor achieved a higher signal-to-noise (S/N) ratio than an earlier acoustic sensor to detect debris flows. A microphone positioned inside a PVC resin pipe immersed in oil produced better acoustic impedance matching in soil, the oil in the pipe, and the microphone element. Laboratory tests showed that electric transformer oil with low viscosity could attain the highest S/N ratio. A field test indicated that the improved sensor detected debris flows at more twice the distance than the earlier sensor. However, the endurance test did not confirm the long-term operation of the improved sensor. A poly-vinylidene chloride film that wraps the microphone element must be thin and without pinholes. The output spectra of the sensor in the laboratory test appeared to reflect some differences in kinds of the medium in the test bucket. In the case of gravel the spectrum had high frequency components. Another type of hydrophone sensor for submarine use had a similar S/N ratio to the improved one with a good endurance except for difficulty achieving an effective grounding to decrease the noise.

paper_title.en: Debris flow velocity estimation: A comparison between gradient-based method and cross-correlation method

description.en: Debris flow causes lot of damages all over the world. The surface velocity of such a natural random flow is one of the important physical parameters that are considered in drawing a hazard map or constructing a sediment control dam. Gradient-based method along with a multiscale smoothing operation finds application in the two-dimensional velocity estimation of a debris flow from its video images. This paper investigates the performance of another optical flow determination technique - the cross-correlation method in the above application and compares the results with those obtained by the gradient-based method. A computer simulation with synthetic random moving images shows that the accuracy of the cross correlation method is higher than that of the gradient-based method.

Debris flow velocity estimation: A comparison between gradient-based method and cross-correlation method

description.en: Debris flow causes lot of damages all over the world. The surface velocity of such a natural random flow is one of the important physical parameters that are considered in drawing a hazard map or constructing a sediment control dam. Gradient-based method along with a multiscale smoothing operation finds application in the two-dimensional velocity estimation of a debris flow from its video images. This paper investigates the performance of another optical flow determination technique - the cross-correlation method in the above application and compares the results with those obtained by the gradient-based method. paper_title.ja: Large motion estimation by gradient technidue:Application to debris-flow velocity field

paper_title.en: Large motion estimation by gradient technidue:Application to debris-flow velocity field
A new double dual-axes accelerometer debris-flow detection system

description.en: The proposed new detection system for debris flow and landslide consists of a base station (BS) and terminal sensors (TSs) installed within a potential landslide area A TS with double dual-axes accelerometer detects its own movement as it shifts with a debris now or landslide and emits an alarm signal. When the BS receives the alarm signal the system switches from standby to active mode and shows each moving TS on a trace map during the first 1 sec. The information is important to display the current state of debris now or landslide and estimate the subsequent movement and hazard Feasibility tests demonstrated the general potentialities of this system.

paper_title.en: Detection of Debris Flow Based on MPEG Video

description.ja: We report the experimental results of debris flow detection based on MPEG video. A detection algorithm utilizes MPEG motion vectors. The advantages of the system are confirmed by simulation with some real debris flow movies.
description.en: We report the experimental results of debris flow detection based on MPEG video. A detection algorithm utilizes MPEG motion vectors. The advantages of the system are confirmed by simulation with some real debris flow movies.

research_project_title.ja: 土石流の検知と速度計測

description.ja: 土石流災害対策として、発生・近接を検知すると共に、非接触空間フィルタ速度計測により速度を計測して動態解析、ハザードマップ作成に資する。
